quizTitle: Operating Systems – Unit 4: Memory Management & Storage Management

questions.questionText: Which of the following memory allocation strategies may suffer from both internal and external fragmentation?
questions.correctAnswer: Contiguous memory allocation

questions.questionText: In paging, the page size is typically a power of two because:
options: It simplifies address translation using bit masking
questions.correctAnswer: It simplifies address translation using bit masking

questions.questionText: Which data structure is used by the operating system to translate logical addresses to physical addresses in paging?
questions.correctAnswer: Page table

questions.questionText: What happens during a page fault?
options: A page is found in physical memory
The operating system swaps a page from memory to disk
The required page is not in memory and must be loaded from disk
questions.correctAnswer: The required page is not in memory and must be loaded from disk

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a page replacement algorithm?
questions.correctAnswer: Round Robin

questions.questionText: The process of swapping involves:
options: Copying data between cache and CPU
Temporarily moving a process from main memory to secondary storage
Relocating pages within the main memory
Converting logical addresses into physical addresses
questions.correctAnswer: Temporarily moving a process from main memory to secondary storage

questions.questionText: In demand paging, the 'valid-invalid bit' in a page table entry indicates:
options: Whether the page has been modified
Whether the page is in main memory
Whether the page is shared between processes
Whether the page is in cache memory
questions.correctAnswer: Whether the page is in main memory

questions.questionText: Thrashing occurs when:
options: Processes are waiting for I/O operations
The CPU spends most of its time swapping pages rather than executing processes
There are too many threads running concurrently
The page size is too large
questions.correctAnswer: The CPU spends most of its time swapping pages rather than executing processes

questions.questionText: Which page replacement algorithm suffers from Belady’s anomaly?
questions.correctAnswer: FIFO

questions.questionText: Copy-on-write is used to:
options: Share pages between processes until a write occurs
questions.correctAnswer: Share pages between processes until a write occurs

questions.questionText: Which of the following allocation methods reduces internal fragmentation but increases external fragmentation?
questions.correctAnswer: Dynamic partitioning

questions.questionText: The optimal page replacement algorithm:
options: Replaces the page that was least recently used
Replaces the page that will not be used for the longest period in the future
questions.correctAnswer: Replaces the page that will not be used for the longest period in the future

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB)?
options: Caches recent page table entries to speed up address translation
questions.correctAnswer: Caches recent page table entries to speed up address translation

questions.questionText: Which of the following scheduling algorithms is used for disk scheduling?
questions.correctAnswer: SSTF (Shortest Seek Time First)

questions.questionText: The 'working set model' is used to:
options: Estimate the set of pages a process is actively using
Determine which processes to swap out
questions.correctAnswer: Estimate the set of pages a process is actively using

questions.questionText: In HDD scheduling, which algorithm can lead to starvation?
questions.correctAnswer: SSTF

questions.questionText: Which of the following best defines 'frame' in the context of paging?
options: A fixed-size block of logical memory
A variable-size block of secondary storage
A fixed-size block of physical memory
questions.correctAnswer: A fixed-size block of physical memory

questions.questionText: Which of the following combinations causes internal fragmentation?
questions.correctAnswer: Paging with fixed frame size

questions.questionText: Which page replacement algorithm approximates LRU using a circular queue and reference bits?
questions.correctAnswer: Clock

questions.questionText: In virtual memory systems, the degree of multiprogramming is limited by:
options: Amount of main memory and page faults
questions.correctAnswer: Amount of main memory and page faults
